terms.en: A system that records changes to files over time so that you can recall specific versions later. It allows multiple developers to collaborate on a project by tracking and managing changes to the codebase. *Version control systems (VCS)* enable developers to work simultaneously on different parts of a project, keep track of every modification, and revert back to previous versions if necessary.
terms.se:
**Ett system som registrerar √§ndringar i filer √∂ver tid s√• att du kan √•terkalla specifika versioner senare**. 
 
 Det g√∂r det m√∂jligt f√∂r flera utvecklare att samarbeta i ett projekt genom att sp√•ra och hantera √§ndringar i kodbasen. *Versionshanteringssystem (VCS)* g√∂r det m√∂jligt att arbeta samtidigt p√• olika delar av ett projekt, h√•lla reda p√• varje √§ndring och √•terst√§lla tidigare versioner vid behov.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt att spara och h√•lla koll p√• olika versioner av filer eller kod s√• att man kan samarbeta och backa om n√•got blir fel.

terms.en: A central location where code and its history are stored and managed, typically using a version control system like Git. It acts as a storage space for all the files, directories, and related resources of a project, along with their version history, enabling collaboration, version tracking, and management of code changes over time. Repositories can be hosted locally on a developer's machine or remotely on platforms like GitHub, GitLab or Bitbucket.
terms.se: **En central plats d√§r kod och dess historik lagras och hanteras**, vanligtvis med ett *versionshanteringssystem* som Git. Det fungerar som **lagringsutrymme f√∂r alla filer, kataloger och relaterade resurser i ett projekt, tillsammans med deras versionshistorik**, vilket m√∂jligg√∂r samarbete, sp√•rning av versioner och hantering av kod√§ndringar √∂ver tid. Repositories kan hostas lokalt p√• en utvecklares dator eller externt p√• plattformar som GitHub, GitLab eller Bitbucket.
terms.seSimple: En plats d√§r projektets filer och alla versioner sparas, antingen p√• datorn eller p√• n√§tet.

terms.en: The stages through which code changes move as they are developed, committed, and integrated into a Git repository. Understanding the Git life cycle is essential for effectively managing changes, collaborating with others, and maintaining a clean project history.
terms.se: Git-fl√∂det beskriver de olika stegen n√§r man arbetar med Git, till exempel att skapa en branch, g√∂ra commits och sedan sl√• ihop √§ndringarna till huvudprojektet.
terms.seSimple: Stegen man g√•r igenom n√§r man jobbar med Git, fr√•n att skriva kod till att spara och sl√• ihop den med resten av projektet.

terms.en: A Merge Conflict occurs when Git is unable to automatically resolve differences between two branches during a merge. This typically happens when changes are made to the same part of a file in different branches, and Git cannot determine which change should take precedence. Merge conflicts must be resolved manually by the developer before the merge can be completed.
terms.se: En merge conflict uppst√•r n√§r tv√• olika √§ndringar krockar i samma fil och Git inte kan avg√∂ra vilken version som ska g√§lla. D√• m√•ste utvecklaren sj√§lv l√∂sa konflikten manuellt innan mergningen kan slutf√∂ras.
terms.seSimple: N√§r Git inte vet vilka √§ndringar som ska g√§lla och man sj√§lv m√•ste v√§lja vilken kod som ska sparas.

terms.en: A markdown file typically found in the root directory of a software project. It serves as the main documentation for the project, providing essential information about the project, how to install and use it, and any other details that developers or users might need to understand and contribute to the project. The '.md' extension stands for markdown, a lightweight markup language that allows for easy formatting or text using plain text syntax.
terms.se: En Markdown-fil som vanligtvis finns i rotkatalogen av ett programvaruprojekt. Den fungerar som projektets huvuddokumentation och ger n√∂dv√§ndig information om projektet, hur man installerar och anv√§nder det samt andra detaljer som utvecklare eller anv√§ndare kan beh√∂va f√∂r att f√∂rst√• och bidra. Till√§gget ‚Äù.md‚Äù st√•r f√∂r Markdown, ett l√§ttviktigt m√§rkspr√•k som m√∂jligg√∂r enkel formatering av text med klartext-syntax.
terms.seSimple: En fil med information om projektet och hur man anv√§nder det.

terms.en: A prioritized list of tasks, features and requirements that a development team needs to work on. It serves as the team's to-do list, where items are added, refined and re-prioritized throughout the project lifecycle. The backlog is central to Agile methodologies, helping teams manage their work and stay focused on delivering the most valuable features first.
terms.se: En prioriterad lista √∂ver uppgifter, funktioner och krav som ett utvecklingsteam beh√∂ver arbeta med. Den fungerar som teamets att-g√∂ra-lista, d√§r objekt l√§ggs till, f√∂rfinas och omprioriteras under projektets livscykel. Backloggen √§r central i agila metoder och hj√§lper team att fokusera p√• att leverera de mest v√§rdefulla funktionerna f√∂rst.
terms.seSimple: En lista p√• saker teamet ska g√∂ra, ordnad efter viktighet.

terms.en: A group of individuals who manage their work and responsibilities autonomously without the need for centralized control or micromanagement. In a self-organizing team, members collectively decide how tasks are distributed, how goals are met, and how problems are solved, leveraging their skills and expertise to achieve the best outcomes. This concept is central to agile methodologies like Scrum and is designed to foster collaboration, accountability, and adaptability.
terms.se: En grupp individer som sj√§lvst√§ndigt organiserar sitt arbete och sina ansvar utan behov av centraliserad styrning eller mikromanagement. I ett sj√§lvorganiserande team beslutar medlemmarna gemensamt hur uppgifter f√∂rdelas, hur m√•l uppn√•s och hur problem l√∂ses, genom att utnyttja sina f√§rdigheter och sin expertis. Konceptet √§r centralt i agila metoder som Scrum och fr√§mjar samarbete, ansvarstagande och anpassningsf√∂rm√•ga.
terms.seSimple: Teamet planerar och organiserar sitt arbete sj√§lva utan chef som styr allt.

terms.en: A design principle in software engineering that advocates dividing a program into distinct sections, each responsible for a specific aspect of the software's functionality. By separating concerns, developers can manage complexity more effectively, improve modularity, and enhance maintainability. Each section, or 'concern', should encapsulate a specific functionality, such as the user interface, business logic, or data access, and interact with other sections through well-defined interfaces.
terms.se: Separation of concerns inneb√§r att programmet delas upp i olika delar d√§r varje del ansvarar f√∂r en specifik funktion, t.ex. gr√§nssnitt, aff√§rslogik eller datalagring. Genom att separera ansvar kan utvecklare hantera komplexitet mer effektivt, f√∂rb√§ttra modularitet och √∂ka underh√•llbarheten.
terms.seSimple: Man delar upp programmet i olika delar s√• att varje del har ett tydligt ansvar.

terms.en: Dependency Management in a React application refers to the process of handling the libraries and packages that your project relies on, ensuring they are correctly installed, updated and configured. This is typically managed through the 'package.json' file, which lists all the dependencies required for the project. Tools like npm (Node Package Manager) or Yarn are used to automate the installation, updating and removal of these dependencies, making it easier to maintain a consistent development environment across different machines.
terms.se: Hantering av bibliotek och paket som ett projekt √§r beroende av, f√∂r att se till att de √§r korrekt installerade, uppdaterade och konfigurerade. Detta hanteras ofta via 'package.json'. Verktyg som npm eller Yarn automatiserar installation, uppdatering och borttagning av dessa beroenden, vilket g√∂r det enklare att uppr√§tth√•lla en konsekvent utvecklingsmilj√∂ √∂ver olika datorer.
terms.seSimple: H√•ller reda p√• vilka paket och bibliotek projektet beh√∂ver och ser till att de fungerar.

terms.en: A tool that automates the process of installing, updating, configuring, and managing software packages or libraries. These packages are collections of code, often shared by other developers, that provide specific functionality or tools to aid in development. Package managers handle the complexities of dependency management, ensuring that the correct versions of packages and their dependencies are installed and compatible with each other.
terms.se: Verktyg som automatiserar installation, uppdatering och hantering av paket eller bibliotek. Dessa paket √§r samlingar av kod, ofta delade av andra utvecklare, som tillhandah√•ller specifik funktionalitet eller verktyg f√∂r att underl√§tta utveckling. Paket-hanterare tar hand om komplexiteten i beroendehantering och s√§kerst√§ller att r√§tt versioner av paket och deras beroenden installeras och √§r kompatibla med varandra. De √§r avg√∂rande i modern mjukvaruutveckling, s√§rskilt i milj√∂er som √§r starkt beroende av externa bibliotek eller moduler.
terms.seSimple: Hj√§lper till att installera och uppdatera paket och bibliotek i projektet.

terms.en: The process of combining multiple files, such as JavaScript, CSS and other assets, into a single or a few output files. This is done to reduce the number of HTTP requests needed to load a webpage, which can improve the loading speed and overall performance of web applications.
terms.se:
Processen att kombinera flera filer, som JavaScript, CSS och andra resurser, till en eller n√•gra f√• filer f√∂r att minska antalet HTTP-f√∂rfr√•gningar och f√∂rb√§ttra laddningstiden. 
 
 --- 
 
 Boundler vs. Minification 
 * Bundling = f√§rre filer. 
 * Minification = mindre filer. 
 
 Ofta anv√§nds b√•da tillsammans: bundlern skapar en enda fil och sen minifieras den f√∂r att bli s√• liten och snabb som m√∂jligt.
terms.seSimple: Sl√•r ihop flera filer (s√• som JS och CSS) till f√§rre filer f√∂r snabbare laddning

terms.en: A popular module bundler for JavaScript applications. It takes modules with dependencies and generates static assets representing those modules. Webpack allows developers to bundle and manage assets such as JavaScript, CSS, images, and fonts into a single file or smaller files, optimizing them for the web.
terms.se: Ett popul√§rt verktyg f√∂r att sl√• ihop moduler i JavaScript-applikationer. Webpack hanterar JavaScript, CSS, bilder och typsnitt, och optimerar dem f√∂r webben. Den √§r mycket konfigurerbar och st√∂der avancerade funktioner som code splitting, tree shaking och hot module replacement (HMR).
terms.seSimple: Verktyg som kombinerar och optimerar filer f√∂r webben.

terms.en: A module bundler for JavaScript applications, primarily used to bundle small pieces of code into larger, more complex applications. Rollup is designed to work with ES6 modules (ECMAScript 2015) and focuses on producing minimal, efficient bundles by eliminating dead code (tree-shaking) and leveraging the latest JavaScript standards.
terms.se: Ett verktyg som sl√•r ihop sm√• kodbitar till st√∂rre applikationer. Rollup arbetar med ES6-moduler och tar bort oanv√§nd kod f√∂r att skapa effektiva paket.
terms.seSimple: Sl√•r ihop kod och tar bort on√∂dig kod.

terms.en: A modern front-end build tool that focuses on speed and performance. Vite is designed to improve the development experience by offering instant server startup, lightning-fast Hot Module Replacement (HMR), and optimized build processes.
terms.se: Ett modernt byggverktyg f√∂r front-end som fokuserar p√• snabbhet och prestanda, med snabb serverstart och HMR.
terms.seSimple: Snabbt byggverktyg f√∂r frontend-utveckling.

terms.en: A tool that automates repetitive development tasks such as minification, compilation, unit testing, linting, and file watching.
terms.se: Verktyg som automatiserar repetitiva utvecklingsuppgifter som minifiering, kompilering och tester.
terms.seSimple: Automatiserar vanliga utvecklingsuppgifter.

terms.en: A set of tools and processes that automate the compilation, packaging, and deployment of software applications.
terms.se: En upps√§ttning verktyg och processer som automatiserar kompilering, paketering och distribution av applikationer.
terms.seSimple: System som bygger och paketerar program automatiskt.

terms.en: In software development, packaging refers to the process of bundling or assembling code, resources, and dependencies into a distributable format.
terms.se: Paketering inneb√§r att sl√• ihop kod, resurser och beroenden till ett format som kan distribueras.
terms.seSimple: Sl√•r ihop kod och resurser s√• att det kan anv√§ndas eller distribueras.

terms.en: A JavaScript transpiler that enables developers to write modern JavaScript (including ES6 and beyond) and convert it into a backwards-compatible version for older environments.
terms.se: Ett verktyg som omvandlar modern JavaScript till en version som fungerar i √§ldre milj√∂er.
terms.seSimple: G√∂r modern JavaScript kompatibel med √§ldre webbl√§sare.

terms.en: The process of analyzing source code to detect and fix potential errors, bugs, stylistic issues, and violations of coding standards.
terms.se: Analys av k√§llkod f√∂r att hitta och √•tg√§rda fel, buggar eller stilproblem.
terms.seSimple: Hittar fel och stilproblem i koden.

terms.en: An optimization technique used in modern JavaScript bundlers to remove dead or unused code from the final output bundle.
terms.se: Teknik f√∂r att ta bort oanv√§nd kod fr√•n den slutliga paketfilen.
terms.seSimple: Tar bort kod som inte anv√§nds.

terms.en: The process of deliberately making source code difficult to understand by transforming it into a version that is functionally equivalent but harder for humans to read.
terms.se: Att medvetet g√∂ra koden sv√•r att f√∂rst√• utan att √§ndra funktionaliteten.
terms.seSimple: G√∂r koden sv√•r att l√§sa.

terms.en: The process of removing all unnecessary characters from source code, such as whitespace, comments, and newlines, without changing its functionality.
terms.se:
Vad det √§r: Tar bort on√∂diga tecken i koden utan att √§ndra funktionalitet. 
 * Byter l√•nga variabelnamn till korta (functionName ‚Üí a). 
 * Syfte: Minska filstorlek ‚Üí snabbare nedladdning. 
 
 --- 
 
 Boundler vs. Minification 
 * Bundling = f√§rre filer. 
 * Minification = mindre filer. 
 
 Ofta anv√§nds b√•da tillsammans: bundlern skapar en enda fil och sen minifieras den f√∂r att bli s√• liten och snabb som m√∂jligt.
terms.seSimple: G√∂r koden mindre utan att √§ndra funktion = minskar filstorleken

terms.en: A workspace or setup where developers write, test, and debug their code before it is released to other environments. It usually includes all necessary tools, libraries, and configurations needed for coding and testing features without affecting production systems.
terms.se: En arbetsmilj√∂ d√§r utvecklare skriver, testar och fels√∂ker sin kod innan den sl√§pps till andra milj√∂er. Inneh√•ller verktyg och bibliotek f√∂r att utveckla utan att p√•verka produktionen.
terms.seSimple: En plats d√§r utvecklare skriver och testar kod utan att st√∂ra det riktiga systemet.

terms.en: A pre-production environment that replicates the production environment as closely as possible. It is used to test new features and changes in a realistic setting before they are deployed to production.
terms.se: En testmilj√∂ som liknar produktionen s√• mycket som m√∂jligt. Anv√§nds f√∂r att testa nya funktioner innan de g√•r live.
terms.seSimple: En n√§stan riktig milj√∂ d√§r man testar innan det sl√§pps p√• riktigt.

terms.en: The live environment where the application is available to end users. Stability, performance, and security are the main priorities in this environment.
terms.se: Den skarpa milj√∂n d√§r applikationen anv√§nds av riktiga anv√§ndare. Fokus √§r p√• stabilitet, prestanda och s√§kerhet.
terms.seSimple: Den riktiga milj√∂n d√§r anv√§ndarna k√∂r programmet.

terms.en: The process of planning, scheduling, and controlling the movement of software releases into different environments, including testing and production.
terms.se: Planering och styrning av hur mjukvara flyttas mellan testmilj√∂er och produktion.
terms.seSimple: Planen f√∂r hur och n√§r ny kod ska sl√§ppas.

terms.en: In software development, an Environment refers to a distinct setup of hardware, software, and configuration settings where specific stages of the software lifecycle, such as development, testing, or production, are carried out. Different environments are used to isolate and manage changes in the application at various stages, ensuring that the software behaves correctly before it is released to end users.
terms.se: Inom mjukvaruutveckling syftar Environment p√• en s√§rskild upps√§ttning av h√•rdvara, mjukvara och konfiguration d√§r olika stadier av mjukvarans livscykel, som utveckling, test eller produktion, genomf√∂rs. Olika milj√∂er anv√§nds f√∂r att isolera och hantera √§ndringar i applikationen s√• att den fungerar korrekt innan den sl√§pps till anv√§ndare.
terms.seSimple: En plats d√§r program utvecklas, testas eller k√∂rs p√• riktigt.

terms.en: A series of automated steps that software goes through as it progresses from development to production. The pipeline typically includes stages such as building the application, running unit and integration tests, deploying to a staging environment for further testing, and finally, deploying to the production environment. Each stage in the pipeline ensures that the code is thoroughly tested and verified, reducing the risk of errors or bugs reaching the production environment. The pipeline is a critical component of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) practices, enabling faster and more reliable software releases.
terms.se: En upps√§ttning automatiserade steg som mjukvara g√•r igenom fr√•n utveckling till produktion. Pipen inkluderar vanligtvis byggsteg, tester, distribution till staging f√∂r vidare testning och slutligen distribution till produktion. Varje steg s√§kerst√§ller att koden testas och verifieras f√∂r att minska risken f√∂r fel i produktionen. Deployment pipeline √§r en central del av CI/CD och m√∂jligg√∂r snabbare och mer tillf√∂rlitliga releaser.
terms.seSimple: En automatiserad process som bygger, testar och sl√§pper ny kod steg f√∂r steg.

terms.en: Deployment is the process of moving an application or its components from one environment to another, typically from development (dev) to testing (test), staging (stage), and finally to production (prod). Each environment serves a specific purpose: dev for development, where code is actively written and modified; test for quality assurance and automated testing; stage for final verification in an environment that closely mirrors production; and prod where the application is made available to end users. Deployment can involve several steps, including building the application, running tests, and transferring the application to the target servers.
terms.se: Deployment √§r processen att flytta en applikation eller dess delar fr√•n en milj√∂ till en annan, ofta fr√•n utveckling till test, staging och slutligen produktion. Varje milj√∂ fyller en s√§rskild funktion: dev f√∂r utveckling, test f√∂r kvalitetss√§kring, stage f√∂r slutlig verifiering och prod f√∂r riktiga anv√§ndare. Deployment kan inkludera byggning, tester och √∂verf√∂ring av applikationen till servrar.
terms.seSimple: Att flytta ett program fr√•n utveckling till test och till slut till riktiga anv√§ndare.

terms.en: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications inside lightweight, portable containers. These containers bundle the application code along with its dependencies, libraries, and configuration files, ensuring that the application runs consistently across different environments, whether on a developer's laptop, on-premise servers, or in the cloud. Docker simplifies the deployment process by allowing developers to package everything the application needs to run into a single container, avoiding the 'it works on my machine' problem.
terms.se: En plattform f√∂r att utveckla, k√∂ra och distribuera applikationer i l√§tta, portabla containrar. Containrarna inneh√•ller kod, beroenden, bibliotek och konfigurationer s√• att applikationen k√∂rs likadant √∂verallt. Docker g√∂r deployment enklare och eliminerar problemet med att n√•got fungerar p√• en dator men inte p√• en annan.
terms.seSimple: Ett verktyg som paketerar program s√• att de fungerar likadant √∂verallt.

terms.en: A lightweight form of virtualization that involves packaging an application along with its dependencies, libraries, and configuration files into a single, portable container. This container can run consistently across different environments, from development to production, regardless of underlying system differences. Containers are isolated from each other and the host system, but they share the host's operating system kernel, making them more efficient than traditional virtual machines.
terms.se: En l√§ttviktig form av virtualisering d√§r en applikation och dess beroenden paketeras i en portabel container. Den k√∂rs konsekvent i olika milj√∂er, fr√•n utveckling till produktion. Containrar √§r isolerade fr√•n varandra men delar operativsystemets k√§rna, vilket g√∂r dem mer effektiva √§n virtuella maskiner.
terms.seSimple: Att k√∂ra program i containrar som fungerar likadant i olika milj√∂er.

terms.en: A cloud computing model where the cloud provider automatically manages the infrastructure, allowing developers to focus solely on writing and deploying code. In a serverless architecture, the server management and capacity planning are abstracted away, and the cloud provider dynamically allocates resources as needed. Developers deploy functions, which are small, independent pieces of code that execute in response to specific events. Popular serverless platforms include AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, and Google Cloud Functions.
terms.se: En molnmodell d√§r leverant√∂ren hanterar all infrastruktur och utvecklare bara fokuserar p√• kod. Serverhantering och kapacitetsplanering d√∂ljs, och resurser f√∂rdelas dynamiskt vid behov. Utvecklare distribuerar funktioner som k√∂rs n√§r vissa h√§ndelser sker. Exempel √§r AWS Lambda, Azure Functions och Google Cloud Functions.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt att k√∂ra kod i molnet utan att beh√∂va t√§nka p√• servrar.

terms.en: A distributed computing paradigm that brings computation and data storage closer to the location where it is needed, typically at the 'edge' of the network, near the devices generating the data. This approach reduces latency, conserves bandwidth, and improves the performance of applications, particularly those requiring real-time processing, by processing data locally rather than relying on a centralized cloud infrastructure.
terms.se: Ett s√§tt att placera ber√§kningar och datalagring n√§rmare de enheter som genererar datan. Det minskar f√∂rdr√∂jning, sparar bandbredd och f√∂rb√§ttrar prestanda, s√§rskilt f√∂r applikationer som kr√§ver realtidsbearbetning, genom att behandla data lokalt ist√§llet f√∂r i ett centralt moln.
terms.seSimple: Att k√∂ra ber√§kningar n√§ra d√§r datan skapas, ist√§llet f√∂r l√•ngt borta i molnet.

terms.en: A version control strategy where multiple projects or components are stored and managed within a single, unified repository. This approach allows all related codebases to coexist, enabling shared code, consistent tooling, and centralized versioning. While a monorepo can simplify development for smaller projects by keeping everything in one place, it can become difficult to manage as the project scales, potentially leading to challenges with build times, dependency management, and coordination among teams. For this reason, monorepos may be more suited to smaller or simpler projects rather than large, complex systems.
terms.se: En strategi f√∂r versionshantering d√§r flera projekt eller komponenter lagras i ett enda gemensamt repository. Detta g√∂r det enklare att dela kod, anv√§nda samma verktyg och ha en central versionhantering. F√∂r sm√• projekt kan detta vara praktiskt, men i stora system kan det skapa problem med byggtider, beroenden och samordning mellan team.
terms.seSimple: Alla projekt och komponenter sparas i samma kodf√∂rr√•d.

terms.en: A software architecture pattern that separates an application into multiple, distinct layers or tiers, each responsible for specific aspects of the application's functionality. This separation of concerns helps to organize code, improve scalability, and manage complexity by allowing each tier to evolve independently. The most common form is a three-tier architecture, but applications can have more or fewer tiers depending on the design requirements. The three-tier architecture typically includes the presentation tier (user interface), the application tier (business logic), and the data tier (database management).
terms.se: Ett m√∂nster d√§r en applikation delas upp i flera lager eller niv√•er som ansvarar f√∂r olika delar av funktionaliteten. Detta g√∂r koden mer organiserad, skalbar och l√§ttare att underh√•lla. Den vanligaste formen √§r tre lager, men det kan vara fler eller f√§rre beroende p√• behov. De tre lagren √§r vanligtvis presentationslagret (gr√§nssnitt), applikationslagret (logik) och datalagret (databashantering).
terms.seSimple: Att dela upp program i flera lager, t.ex. *data, logik och gr√§nssnitt*.

terms.en: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services. Each microservice is responsible for a specific piece of functionality, such as user authentication, payment processing, or product management, and communicates with other services over a network, typically using HTTP/REST, gRPC, or messaging queues. This approach contrasts with monolithic architectures, where all functionality is tightly integrated into a single application.
terms.se: En arkitektur d√§r en applikation delas upp i sm√•, frist√•ende tj√§nster som var och en ansvarar f√∂r en specifik funktion, t.ex. inloggning eller betalningar. Dessa tj√§nster kommunicerar via n√§tverk. Detta skiljer sig fr√•n monolitiska system d√§r allt √§r samlat i en applikation.
terms.seSimple: En applikation delas upp i sm√•, frist√•ende tj√§nster

terms.en: Refers to the server-side infrastructure of an application, handling business logic, database interactions, user authentication, and other core functions that occur behind the scenes. It serves as the backbone of an application, processing requests from the front end and sending appropriate responses.
terms.se: Avser serverdelen av en applikation som hanterar logik, databaser, anv√§ndarhantering och andra centrala funktioner som sker i bakgrunden.
terms.seSimple: Den del av programmet som k√∂rs p√• servern och sk√∂ter logik och data.

terms.en: Refers to the collection of tools, libraries, frameworks, and technologies used to build the user-facing part of a web application or website. This system is responsible for everything users interact with directly in their web browsers, including the user interface, navigation, content rendering, and dynamic behavior. A robust frontend system ensures a responsive, interactive, and seamless user experience across different devices and platforms.
terms.se: Avser verktyg, ramverk och tekniker som anv√§nds f√∂r att bygga den del av en webbapplikation som anv√§ndarna ser och interagerar med. Det omfattar gr√§nssnitt, navigation, inneh√•ll och dynamiskt beteende.
terms.seSimple: Den del av hemsidan som anv√§ndaren ser och anv√§nder.

terms.en: A design pattern used in web development to separate concerns within an application. It divides an application into three interconnected components: the Model (which represents the data or business logic), the View (which represents the UI or presentation layer), and the Controller (which handles user input and updates the Model and View accordingly). This pattern is commonly used in web frameworks to organize code in a way that promotes modularity, scalability, and maintainability.
terms.se: Ett m√∂nster som delar upp en applikation i tre delar: Model (data och logik), View (gr√§nssnitt) och Controller (hanterar inmatning och uppdaterar Model och View). Anv√§nds ofta i webbapplikationer f√∂r att organisera koden.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt att dela upp kod i data, gr√§nssnitt och styrning.

terms.en: In React, a Component is a reusable, self-contained piece of UI that encapsulates its own structure, logic, and style. Components can be either functional or class-based and are the building blocks of a React application. They receive data via props and manage their own state to render UI dynamically based on user interaction or data changes. In a broader software architecture context, a Component can also refer to a backend microservice or any modular part of a system that performs a specific function independently. In this case, components interact with each other via well-defined interfaces, often through APIs or message queues, contributing to the overall functionality of an application.
terms.se: I React √§r en komponent en √•teranv√§ndbar, sj√§lvst√§ndig del av gr√§nssnittet med egen struktur, logik och stil. I ett bredare sammanhang kan en komponent ocks√• vara en del av backend eller annan modul√§r del av systemet som sk√∂ter en funktion.
terms.seSimple: En modul som sk√∂ter en del av ett system, t.ex. en knapp eller en tj√§nst.

terms.en: A principle of software development aimed at reducing repetition of code, logic, or data within a system. The DRY principle encourages developers to avoid duplicating code by abstracting repeated logic or data into reusable components, functions, or modules. This approach promotes cleaner, more maintainable code, and reduces the risk of errors by ensuring that any change only needs to be made in one place.
terms.se: En princip som handlar om att undvika upprepning av kod och logik. Ist√§llet b√∂r man √•teranv√§nda komponenter och funktioner f√∂r att f√• renare och l√§ttare underh√•llen kod.
terms.seSimple: En regel som s√§ger att man inte ska skriva samma kod flera g√•nger.

terms.en: A methodology for building modern, scalable, and maintainable software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications. It was introduced by developers at Heroku to provide best practices for building web applications that can be easily deployed and scaled in cloud environments. The methodology outlines twelve principles that address various aspects of software development, from codebase management to deployment and operational concerns.
terms.se:
En **twelve-factor app** √§r en metodik f√∂r att bygga mjukvara som en tj√§nst (SaaS-appar) p√• ett h√•llbart, portabelt och skalbart s√§tt. Den togs fram av utvecklare p√• **Heroku** f√∂r att ge riktlinjer kring hur moderna webbapplikationer b√∂r designas och drifts√§ttas i molnmilj√∂er. 
 
 Syftet √§r att g√∂ra appar: 
 
 * **B√§rbara** mellan olika milj√∂er (lokalt, test, produktion, olika molnleverant√∂rer) 
 * **Enkla att skala** horisontellt (l√§gga till fler instanser) 
 * **Robusta** och l√§tta att underh√•lla √∂ver tid 
 
 De **tolv faktorerna** √§r: 
 
 1. **Codebase** ‚Äì En kodbas, versionshanterad (t.ex. Git), m√•nga deployer. 
 2. **Dependencies** ‚Äì Deklarera och isolera beroenden tydligt. 
 3. **Config** ‚Äì Lagra konfiguration i milj√∂variabler, inte i koden. 
 4. **Backing services** ‚Äì Behandla tj√§nster som databaser och k√∂er som utbytbara resurser. 
 5. **Build, release, run** ‚Äì Separera bygg-, release- och k√∂rfaser. 
 6. **Processes** ‚Äì K√∂r appen som en eller flera stateless-processer. 
 7. **Port binding** ‚Äì Exportera tj√§nster via portbindning, inte via extern webserver. 
 8. **Concurrency** ‚Äì Skala genom processer, inte tr√•dar. 
 9. **Disposability** ‚Äì G√∂r processer snabba att starta och avsluta f√∂r b√§ttre robusthet. 
 10. **Dev/prod parity** ‚Äì H√•ll utveckling, test och produktion s√• lika som m√∂jligt. 
 11. **Logs** ‚Äì Behandla loggar som str√∂mmande h√§ndelser, inte som filer. 
 12. **Admin processes** ‚Äì K√∂r administrativa/eng√•ngsskript separat fr√•n huvudprocesserna.
terms.seSimple: En lista med regler f√∂r hur man bygger bra molnapplikationer.

terms.en: A type of program that directly executes instructions written in a programming or scripting language without requiring them to be compiled into machine code first. Instead of translating the entire source code into a lower-level language (as a compiler does), an interpreter processes the source code line by line or statement by statement, translating and executing it on the fly. This can lead to slower execution times compared to compiled languages, but offers the advantage of immediate execution and ease of debugging.
terms.se: En typ av program som direkt exekverar instruktioner skrivna i ett programmerings- eller skriptspr√•k utan att f√∂rst kompileras till maskinkod. Tolken bearbetar koden rad f√∂r rad eller sats f√∂r sats och exekverar den direkt. Detta g√∂r k√∂rningen l√•ngsammare √§n med kompilerade spr√•k men enklare att testa och fels√∂ka.
terms.seSimple: Ett program som k√∂r koden rad f√∂r rad direkt.

terms.en: A program that translates code written in a high-level programming language (such as C, C++, or Java) into a lower-level language, typically machine code or bytecode, that can be executed directly by a computer's hardware or runtime environment. The primary goal of a compiler is to optimize and produce efficient executable code that can run on the target machine. A Transpiler (like Babel) also translates code, but instead of converting it to a lower-level language, it converts it from one high-level language or version to another (e.g., modern JavaScript ES6 to ES5). While a compiler targets machine-level code, a transpiler typically focuses on maintaining the same level of abstraction, just making the code compatible with different environments or versions.
terms.se: Ett program som √∂vers√§tter kod skriven i h√∂gniv√•spr√•k (som C, C++ eller Java) till ett l√§gre niv√•spr√•k, oftast maskinkod eller bytekod, som kan k√∂ras direkt av datorn. Syftet √§r att skapa optimerad och effektiv k√∂rbar kod. En transpiler √∂vers√§tter d√§remot mellan spr√•k eller versioner p√• samma niv√•.
terms.seSimple: Ett program som √∂vers√§tter kod till spr√•k som datorn kan k√∂ra.

terms.en: A type of compiler that translates source code from one programming language or syntax into another language or syntax at the same level of abstraction. In web development, transpilers are often used to convert modern JavaScript (ES6+) or JSX (used in React) into a version of JavaScript that is compatible with older browsers or environments that do not natively support newer syntax.
terms.se: En typ av kompilator som √∂vers√§tter k√§llkod fr√•n ett spr√•k eller syntax till ett annat p√• samma abstraktionsniv√•. Vanligt i webbutveckling f√∂r att g√∂ra modern JavaScript kompatibel med √§ldre webbl√§sare.
terms.seSimple: Ett program som g√∂r om ny kod till √§ldre versioner som fler kan anv√§nda.

terms.en: A module system for JavaScript, primarily used in server-side development with Node.js. It allows developers to structure their code into reusable modules, making it easier to manage dependencies and maintain large codebases. Modules in CommonJS are loaded synchronously using the require function, and they export their functionality using module.exports.
terms.se: Ett modulsystem f√∂r JavaScript, fr√§mst i Node.js. G√∂r det m√∂jligt att dela upp koden i √•teranv√§ndbara moduler. Moduler laddas med require och exporteras med module.exports.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt att dela upp och √•teranv√§nda kod i Node.js.

terms.en: require is a function in Node.js, used as part of the CommonJS module system, to synchronously load and use modules. It allows you to import functionality from other files or modules into your current file. Unlike the ES6 import statement, require can be called conditionally and at any point in the code, making it flexible but synchronous in nature. require is primarily used in Node.js environments to load CommonJS modules.
terms.se: require √§r en funktion i Node.js som anv√§nds i CommonJS-modulsystemet f√∂r att synkront ladda och anv√§nda moduler. Till skillnad fr√•n import kan require anropas n√§r som helst i koden.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt att h√§mta in kod fr√•n andra filer i Node.js.

terms.en: A statement in JavaScript used to bring in modules and their exports from other files into the current file. It is part of the ES6 module system, which is designed to allow for modular programming and code reuse. Unlike require, import is statically analyzed, meaning it is hoisted and processed before the rest of the code runs. import supports both named imports and default imports, and while it is usually static, dynamic imports are also possible using import().
terms.se: En sats i JavaScript f√∂r att importera moduler och deras exporter fr√•n andra filer. √Ñr en del av ES6-modulsystemet som g√∂r kod mer modul√§r. import analyseras innan koden k√∂rs, till skillnad fr√•n require.
terms.seSimple: Ett modernt s√§tt att h√§mta in kod fr√•n andra filer i JavaScript.

terms.en: ES6, also known as ECMAScript 2015, is the sixth edition of the ECMAScript language specification, and it brought significant updates to JavaScript. ES6 introduced new features and syntax that improved the language's power, readability, and ease of use, especially for building complex applications. Browser Support: Modern browsers have largely adopted ES6 features, but older browsers may require transpilation (e.g., using Babel) to convert ES6 code into ES5, ensuring compatibility.
terms.se: ES6, √§ven kallad ECMAScript 2015, √§r den sj√§tte versionen av ECMAScript-specifikationen. Den introducerade stora nyheter i JavaScript som f√∂rb√§ttrade spr√•kets kraft och l√§sbarhet. Moderna webbl√§sare st√∂der ES6, men √§ldre kr√§ver transpilation till ES5.
terms.seSimple: En nyare version av JavaScript med fler funktioner.

terms.en: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that allows developers to execute JavaScript code on the server side. Built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine, Node.js is designed for building scalable, high-performance applications, particularly those that require real-time data interaction, such as web servers, APIs, and streaming services. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model, making it efficient and suitable for applications that handle a large number of simultaneous connections.
terms.se:
Node.js √§r en √∂ppen k√§llkod och plattformsoberoende JavaScript-runtime f√∂r att k√∂ra JavaScript p√• serversidan. Byggd p√• Chromes V8-motor och designad f√∂r skalbara och h√∂gpresterande applikationer. 
 
 --- 
 
 # Node.js vs Express.js ‚Äì Fusklapp 
 
 **Node.js** 
  - JavaScript-runtime p√• serversidan. 
  - Bygger p√• V8-motorn (Chrome). 
  - Ger API:er f√∂r filsystem, n√§tverk, processhantering. 
  - Kan k√∂ra servrar direkt med inbyggda moduler (`http`). 
 
 **Express.js** 
  - Webbramverk byggt ovanp√• Node.js. 
  - F√∂renklar skapandet av webbservrar och API:er. 
  - Har routing (`GET /users`), middleware (autentisering, loggning). 
  - Abstraherar `req` och `res` s√• att du slipper low-level kod. 
 
 üëâ **Sammanfattning:** 
 
 Node.js = grunden (motor + verktyg). 
 Express.js = ramverk som g√∂r serverutveckling snabbare och enklare.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt att k√∂ra JavaScript p√• servern, inte bara i webbl√§saren.

terms.en: Express.js is a minimal and flexible web application framework for Node.js. It provides a robust set of features for building web and mobile applications, including tools for routing, middleware management, and handling HTTP requests and responses. Express.js simplifies the process of creating server-side applications, allowing developers to focus on writing the business logic rather than dealing with the underlying infrastructure.
terms.se:
Express.js √§r ett ramverk f√∂r Node.js som g√∂r det enklare att bygga webbapplikationer och API:er. Det erbjuder routing, middleware och hantering av HTTP-f√∂rfr√•gningar. 
 
 --- 
 
 # Node.js vs Express.js ‚Äì Fusklapp 
 
 **Node.js** 
  - JavaScript-runtime p√• serversidan. 
  - Bygger p√• V8-motorn (Chrome). 
  - Ger API:er f√∂r filsystem, n√§tverk, processhantering. 
  - Kan k√∂ra servrar direkt med inbyggda moduler (`http`). 
 
 **Express.js** 
  - Webbramverk byggt ovanp√• Node.js. 
  - F√∂renklar skapandet av webbservrar och API:er. 
  - Har routing (`GET /users`), middleware (autentisering, loggning). 
  - Abstraherar `req` och `res` s√• att du slipper low-level kod. 
 
 üëâ **Sammanfattning:** 
 
 Node.js = grunden (motor + verktyg). 
 
 Express.js = ramverk som g√∂r serverutveckling snabbare och enklare.
terms.seSimple: Ett verktyg som g√∂r det enklare att bygga servrar med Node.js.

terms.en: Refers to the execution of scripts, typically written in languages like JavaScript, within the user's web browser rather than on the server. This allows web pages to be dynamic, interactive, and responsive to user input without requiring a page reload. Common tasks for client-side scripts include form validation, DOM manipulation, and making asynchronous requests to a server (AJAX).
terms.se: Avser k√∂rning av skript i anv√§ndarens webbl√§sare ist√§llet f√∂r p√• servern. Detta g√∂r webbsidor mer interaktiva och responsiva utan att sidan beh√∂ver laddas om.
terms.seSimple: Kod som k√∂rs direkt i webbl√§saren, t.ex. f√∂r interaktiva sidor.

terms.en: The process of writing code that runs on a server rather than on the client (browser). This scripting is responsible for generating dynamic web content, interacting with databases, handling user requests, and managing application logic before sending the final output to the client's browser. Common server-side scripting languages include PHP, Node.js (JavaScript), Python, Ruby, and Java.
terms.se: Kod som k√∂rs p√• en server ist√§llet f√∂r i webbl√§saren. Den skapar dynamiskt inneh√•ll, pratar med databaser och hanterar anv√§ndarf√∂rfr√•gningar.
terms.seSimple: Kod som k√∂rs p√• servern och skickar resultatet till webbl√§saren.

terms.en: A set of rules that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.
terms.se: Ett regelverk som g√∂r det m√∂jligt f√∂r olika mjukvaror att kommunicera med varandra.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt f√∂r olika program att prata med varandra.

terms.en: A style of web service architecture that follows the principles of REST (Representational State Transfer). RESTful services are designed to be stateless, scalable, and easily maintainable, allowing different systems to communicate over the web using standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc. RESTful APIs are commonly used to expose data and functionality of web applications to other systems, such as front-end clients or other backend services.
terms.se: En arkitektur f√∂r webbtj√§nster som f√∂ljer REST-principerna. RESTful-tj√§nster √§r stateless, skalbara och enkla att underh√•lla. De anv√§nder standard-HTTP-metoder som GET, POST och DELETE.
terms.seSimple: Ett s√§tt f√∂r system att prata via webben med vanliga webbanrop.

terms.en: In JavaScript, persistency refers to the ability to store data in a way that it remains available across different sessions, application restarts, or system reboots. Persistent storage ensures that data is not lost when a user closes their browser or when a server shuts down, making it crucial for maintaining state, user preferences, and application data over time.
terms.se: I JavaScript betyder persistens att data sparas s√• att den finns kvar √§ven efter att anv√§ndaren st√§nger webbl√§saren eller n√§r servern startas om. Detta √§r viktigt f√∂r att bevara state, anv√§ndarinst√§llningar och data.
terms.seSimple: Att spara data s√• att den inte f√∂rsvinner n√§r man st√§nger webbl√§saren.

terms.en: A software testing method where individual units or components of a software application are tested in isolation from the rest of the application. The primary goal of unit testing is to verify that each unit functions correctly on its own. Unit tests are typically written and run by developers and are known for being fast and efficient, providing quick feedback on the correctness of the code during development.
terms.se: En testmetod d√§r enskilda enheter eller komponenter i en applikation testas isolerat fr√•n resten av systemet. M√•let √§r att verifiera att varje enhet fungerar korrekt p√• egen hand. Unit-tester √§r snabba och skrivs oftast av utvecklare f√∂r att snabbt ge √•terkoppling om kodens korrekthet.
terms.seSimple: Testar sm√• delar av koden f√∂r att se att de fungerar.

terms.en: Involves testing individual components of a software application in isolation to ensure they function correctly. This type of testing treats the component as a 'black box,' focusing on the inputs and expected outputs without considering the internal workings. It's commonly used in the context of UI components in frameworks like React, where you test how a specific component behaves under various conditions.
terms.se: Test av enskilda komponenter i en applikation f√∂r att se till att de fungerar som de ska. Testet fokuserar p√• indata och f√∂rv√§ntade resultat utan att titta p√• komponentens inre logik. Vanligt inom UI-testning i t.ex. React.
terms.seSimple: Testar enskilda delar, som en knapp eller komponent i en app.

terms.en: A level of software testing where individual units or components are combined and tested as a group. The primary goal of integration testing is to identify issues that occur when different components interact with each other, such as mismatches in data formats, incorrect interfaces, or unexpected behavior when units are integrated. This type of testing ensures that the components of a system work together as expected and that their interactions produce the correct results.
terms.se: En testniv√• d√§r olika komponenter eller moduler kombineras och testas tillsammans. Syftet √§r att uppt√§cka problem som uppst√•r vid interaktion mellan enheterna, som fel i dataformat eller gr√§nssnitt.
terms.seSimple: Testar att olika delar fungerar ihop.

terms.en: The final phase of the software testing process where the actual users of the software test the system in a real-world environment to ensure that it meets their needs and requirements. This type of testing focuses on validating that the software performs as expected from the user's perspective, addressing both functionality and usability before the product is released to production.
terms.se: Den sista testfasen d√§r riktiga anv√§ndare testar systemet i en verklig milj√∂ f√∂r att se att det uppfyller deras behov. Fokuserar p√• b√•de funktionalitet och anv√§ndbarhet innan lansering.
terms.seSimple: Anv√§ndare testar om programmet fungerar som de vill.

terms.en: A software development process in which developers write tests for a new feature or functionality before writing the actual code to implement it. The TDD cycle typically involves writing a failing test, writing the minimum code necessary to pass the test, and then refactoring the code while ensuring that all tests continue to pass. TDD promotes the creation of cleaner, more reliable code by ensuring that every piece of functionality is backed by a corresponding test.
terms.se: En utvecklingsmetod d√§r tester skrivs innan sj√§lva koden. Cykeln √§r: skriv ett misslyckat test, skriv minsta m√∂jliga kod f√∂r att klara testet, och refaktorera sedan koden. TDD leder till mer p√•litlig och v√§lstrukturerad kod.
terms.seSimple: Man skriver tester f√∂rst och kodar sen s√• att testerna g√•r igenom.

terms.en: In software testing, a Dummy is a type of testing double used as a placeholder object that is passed around but never actually used in the test. Dummies are typically utilized when a method or function requires an argument, but the specific value of that argument is irrelevant to the test being conducted. The primary purpose of a dummy is to fulfill the requirements of the function signature without influencing the outcome of the test.
terms.se:
En Dummy √§r en test-dubbel som fungerar som en platsh√•llare i tester. Den anv√§nds n√§r en metod kr√§ver ett argument, men v√§rdet √§r irrelevant f√∂r testet. 
 
 *Exempel:* Skicka in `null` eller en tom str√§ng f√∂r att en metod kr√§ver ett argument.
terms.seSimple: En fejk som bara fyller en plats men inte g√∂r n√•got.

terms.en: A type of testing double used in software testing that replaces a real object or method with a simplified version that provides predefined responses. Unlike mocks or spies, stubs do not record interactions or track how they are used; they simply return hard-coded values or responses when called. Stubs are particularly useful when you need to isolate the component under test by removing dependencies on external systems or complex objects, ensuring that the test focuses solely on the logic being tested.
terms.se:
En Stub √§r en test-dubbel som ers√§tter ett objekt eller metod med en f√∂renklad version som returnerar f√∂rdefinierade svar. Den loggar inte anrop, utan anv√§nds f√∂r att isolera testet fr√•n externa beroenden. 
 
 *Exempel:* En metod som alltid returnerar `ok` oavsett input.
terms.seSimple: En fejk som alltid ger samma svar.

terms.en: A type of testing double used in software testing that provides a working, but simplified, implementation of a component or service. Unlike dummies or stubs, which do not carry out any real logic, a fake mimics the behavior of a real object but with less complexity, making it suitable for testing purposes. Fakes are often used when the real object is too resource-intensive or complex to use in a test environment, such as a database or an external API.
terms.se:
En Fake √§r en test-dubbel som har en fungerande men f√∂renklad version av en komponent eller tj√§nst. Den anv√§nds ist√§llet f√∂r den riktiga n√§r denna √§r f√∂r tung eller komplex f√∂r testmilj√∂n. 
 
 *Exempel:* En in-memory-databas ist√§llet f√∂r en riktig databas.
terms.seSimple: En f√∂renklad version som fungerar p√• riktigt men enklare.

terms.en: A Spy is a type of testing double used in software testing that wraps around a real object or function and records information about how it is used during the test, such as method calls and the arguments passed. Unlike mocks or stubs, a spy does not replace the original functionality; instead, it monitors and tracks interactions without altering the behavior of the underlying code. Spies are particularly useful for verifying that certain methods were called, how many times they were called, and with what parameters, while still allowing the original logic to be executed.
terms.se:
En Spy √§r en test-dubbel som anv√§nds f√∂r att √∂vervaka hur en metod eller funktion anropas under ett test. Den ers√§tter inte logiken utan loggar bara interaktioner som vilka metoder som k√∂rts och med vilka argument. 
 
 *Exempel:* Kontrollera efter√•t om `save()` kallades med r√§tt parameter.
terms.seSimple: En fejk som kollar hur en funktion anv√§nds.

terms.en: A type of testing double used in software testing that not only simulates the behavior of real objects but also records the interactions with it, such as method calls and arguments passed. Mocks are particularly useful when you need to verify that certain methods were called during the execution of a test and to check the specific interactions between components. Mocks can be pre-programmed with expectations that define what methods should be called and with what parameters, making them more sophisticated than other testing doubles like stubs or dummies.
terms.se:
En Mock √§r en test-dubbel som b√•de simulerar beteendet av ett riktigt objekt och loggar interaktionerna. Den kan f√∂rv√§ntas anropas p√• ett visst s√§tt och testet misslyckas om detta inte sker. 
 
 *Exempel:* Kontrollera att `sendEmail()` anropas exakt en g√•ng.
terms.seSimple: En fejk som b√•de beter sig som det riktiga och kollar hur det anv√§nds.

terms.en: A popular JavaScript testing framework developed by Facebook, designed primarily for testing React applications, but also suitable for any JavaScript project. Jest provides a powerful, flexible, and easy-to-use environment for writing and running tests. It includes features like zero-configuration setup, an easy-to-understand syntax, built-in mocking capabilities, and snapshot testing. Jest also supports testing asynchronous code and has a rich set of matchers for assertions.
terms.se: Ett popul√§rt JavaScript-testframework utvecklat av Facebook, fr√§mst f√∂r React men √§ven f√∂r andra projekt. Jest √§r l√§tt att anv√§nda, kr√§ver ingen konfiguration och erbjuder funktioner som mocking och snapshot-tester.

terms.en: A lightweight testing utility that provides tools for testing React components. Unlike traditional testing frameworks, React Testing Library focuses on testing components from the perspective of the user, ensuring that your tests are more reliable and maintainable by simulating user interactions and verifying the behavior of the component as it would be in a real environment. It is often used in conjunction with testing frameworks like Jest.
terms.se: Ett l√§ttviktigt testverktyg f√∂r React-komponenter. Det fokuserar p√• att testa komponenter ur anv√§ndarens perspektiv genom att simulera interaktioner och kontrollera beteende. Ofta anv√§nds det tillsammans med Jest.

terms.en: A modern, end-to-end testing framework designed specifically for web applications. It allows developers to write tests that run directly in the browser, simulating user interactions and verifying that the application behaves as expected. Cypress is known for its fast execution, real-time reloading, and built-in dashboard that provides detailed insights into test results. It's particularly popular for testing complex JavaScript applications built with frameworks like React, Angular, and Vue.js.
terms.se: Ett modernt end-to-end-testframework f√∂r webbl√§sarapplikationer. Cypress k√∂r tester direkt i webbl√§saren och simulerar anv√§ndarinteraktioner. Det √§r snabbt, erbjuder live-reload och ett detaljerat dashboard f√∂r testresultat.

terms.en: The practice of frequently integrating code changes into a shared repository, where automated builds and tests are run to catch errors early.

terms.en: An extension of Continuous Integration where code changes are automatically deployed to production after passing automated tests, ensuring that software is always in a releasable state.

terms.en: A powerful CI/CD platform that allows developers to automate tasks, such as building, testing and deploying code, directly from their GitHub repositories. With GitHub Actions, you can create custom workflows that are triggered by specific events (like a push, pull request, or issue creation) to streamline your development process.
terms.se: En kraftfull CI/CD-plattform som l√•ter utvecklare automatisera uppgifter s√•som bygg, test och drifts√§ttning direkt fr√•n sina GitHub-repositories. Med GitHub Actions kan du skapa anpassade arbetsfl√∂den som triggas av specifika h√§ndelser (som push, pull request eller skapande av issue) f√∂r att effektivisera utvecklingsprocessen.
terms.seSimple: I/CD-verktyg integrerat i GitHub. Automatiserar bygg, test och deployment vid h√§ndelser som push/pull request

terms.en: The practice of constantly tracking, analiyzing and reporting the performance, security and reliability of an application or system in real-time. This process helps to identify and resolve issues before they affect end users, ensuring the application runs smoothly. Continuous monitoring typically involves tracking metrics such as system health, uptime, response times, error rates, and security threats.
terms.se: Praktiken att kontinuerligt sp√•ra, analysera och rapportera prestanda, s√§kerhet och tillf√∂rlitlighet f√∂r en applikation eller ett system i realtid. Denna process hj√§lper till att identifiera och √•tg√§rda problem innan de p√•verkar slutanv√§ndare och s√§kerst√§ller att applikationen k√∂rs smidigt. Kontinuerlig √∂vervakning inneb√§r vanligtvis att man f√∂ljer m√§tv√§rden s√•som systemh√§lsa, upptid, svarstider, felfrekvenser och s√§kerhetshot.

terms.en: A lightweight markup language used for formatting text. It is designed to be easy to read and write, using plain text formatting syntax that can be converted to HTML, for web content, Markdown is widely used for writing documentation, README files, blog posts, and other content where simplicity and readability in plain text are important. (Key Features: Simple Syntax, Easy to Convert, Widespread Use)
terms.se: Ett l√§ttviktigt m√§rkspr√•k som anv√§nds f√∂r att formatera text. Det √§r utformat f√∂r att vara l√§tt att l√§sa och skriva, med ren text-syntax som kan konverteras till HTML f√∂r webbinneh√•ll. (Nyckelfunktioner: Enkel syntax, l√§tt att konvertera, utbredd anv√§ndning)
terms.seSimple: Ett enkelt textformat som konverteras till HTML. Vanligt f√∂r README-filer och dokumentation.

terms.en: A human-readable data serialization format commonly used for configuration files and data exchange between languages with different data structures. The .yml or .yaml file extension is used for files written in YAML. It is known for its simplicity and ease of use, allowing developers to define data in a clear and structured manner without the complexity of other formats like XML or JSON.
terms.se: Ett m√§nniskol√§sbart serialiseringsformat f√∂r data, ofta anv√§nt f√∂r konfigurationsfiler och datautbyte mellan spr√•k med olika datastrukturer. terms.en: A feature in modern web development tools that allows modules of an application to be updated in the browser without requiring a full page reload. This feature is particularly useful during development, as it enables faster iteration by instantly applying changes to the application's code while preserving the current state.
terms.se: En funktion i moderna utvecklingsverktyg som g√∂r det m√∂jligt att uppdatera moduler i en applikation i webbl√§saren utan full omladdning av sidan. Detta √§r s√§rskilt anv√§ndbart under utveckling d√• det m√∂jligg√∂r snabbare iteration genom att direkt till√§mpa kod√§ndringar samtidigt som aktuellt tillst√•nd bevaras. Typiskt anv√§nds HMR i verktyg som Webpack och Vite.

terms.en: Refers to the amount of time it takes for a developer to set up a project or environment and reach the point where they can run a basic 'Hello World!' program. This metric is often used to measure how quickly and easily a new developer can get started with a tool, framework, or project. A lower TTFHW indicates a more user-friendly setup process and a smoother onboarding experience.
terms.se: Avser den tid det tar f√∂r en utvecklare att s√§tta upp ett projekt eller en milj√∂ och n√• punkten d√§r hen kan k√∂ra ett grundl√§ggande 'Hello World!'-program. Ett l√§gre TTFHW indikerar en mer anv√§ndarv√§nlig setup och en smidigare onboarding-upplevelse.
